Package ohos.aafwk.ability

Class IntentAbility

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.app.AbilityContext
      • ohos.aafwk.ability.Ability
        • ohos.aafwk.ability.IntentAbility
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ILifecycle, Context

    public abstract class IntentAbility
extends Ability
    A base class for abilities using the Service template that is used to process background tasks in worker threads to avoid running time-consuming tasks in the main thread, ensuring the application responsiveness.

    This class is a child class of Ability. You do not need to handle thread management-related works once this class is used.

    You should override the onProcessIntent(ohos.aafwk.content.Intent) method and use it to handle required tasks. This method will be executed in a worker thread.

    If there are multiple tasks, the system executes only one task at a time in the order of task arrival time. After all tasks are complete, the IntentAbility object automatically stops, and * you do not need to call Ability#stopAbility(Intent intent) to stop it.

    Since:
    3
    SystemCapability
    SystemCapability.Aafwk#ABILITY

    • Constructor Detail

      • IntentAbility

        public IntentAbility​(String name)
        A constructor used to create an IntentAbility instance.
        Parameters:
        name - Indicates the ability name, which is also used to identify a worker thread.

    • Method Detail

      • onStart

        protected void onStart​(Intent intent)
        Called when the ability is starting, and only be called once through its whole lifecycle.

        You do not need to override this method for your child class. If you have to, override it by calling the method in the IntentAbility base class.

        Overrides:
        onStart in class Ability
        Parameters:
        intent - Indicates information carried when this ability is started. Note: For a Service ability, null is passed.
        See Also:
        Ability.onStart(Intent)

      • onCommand

        @Deprecated
protected void onCommand​(Intent intent,
                         boolean restart)
        Deprecated. 
        Called back when a Service ability is started.

        You do not need to override this method for your child class. If you have to, override it by calling the method in the IntentAbility base class.

        Overrides:
        onCommand in class Ability
        Parameters:
        intent - Indicates the intent of the Service ability to start.
        restart - Indicates the startup mode. The value true indicates that the Service ability is restarted after being destroyed, and the value false indicates a normal startup.
        See Also:
        Ability.onCommand(Intent, boolean)

      • onCommand

        protected void onCommand​(Intent intent,
                         boolean restart,
                         int startId)
        Called back when a Service ability is started.

        You do not need to override this method for your child class. If you have to, override it by calling the method in the IntentAbility base class.

        Overrides:
        onCommand in class Ability
        Parameters:
        intent - Indicates the intent of Service to start.
        restart - Indicates the startup mode. The value true indicates that Service is restarted after being destroyed, and the value false indicates a normal startup.
        startId - Indicates the number of times the Service ability has been started. The startId is incremented by 1 every time the ability is started. For example, if the ability has been started for six times, the value of startId is 6.
        See Also:
        Ability.onCommand(Intent, boolean, int)

      • onProcessIntent

        protected abstract void onProcessIntent​(Intent intent)
        Called for handling tasks every time the ability starts and onCommand(ohos.aafwk.content.Intent,boolean) is called.

        You should override this method for your IntentAbility child class. This method will be executed in a separate worker thread instead of the main thread to prevent time-consuming tasks from affecting the application responsiveness.

        Parameters:
        intent - Indicates the Intent object containing the task information.
